title: Dessert Crepes Recipe
description: This crepe recipe is made with basic pantry staples and turns out perfectly delicate with crisp edges for a fancy breakfast or eye-catching dessert.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Crepes Sweet Dessert Crepes 4.8 (1,207) 862 Reviews 277 Photos This crepe recipe is essential for a fancy breakfast or eye-catching dessert. Sprinkle warm crepes with sugar and lemon, or serve with whipped cream, ice cream, and fruit. Submitted by Ann Updated on August 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 277 277 277 277 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 8 crepes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 4 eggs, lightly beaten 1 ⅓ cups milk 1 cup all-purpose flour 2 tablespoons butter, melted 2 tablespoons white sugar ½ teaspoon salt Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk together eggs, milk, flour, melted butter, sugar, and salt in a large bowl until smooth. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat a medium skillet or crepe pan over medium heat. Grease the pan with a small amount of butter or oil applied with a brush or paper towel. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Using a serving spoon or small ladle, spoon about 3 tablespoons crepe batter onto the hot pan, tilting the pan to evenly coat the bottom surface. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Cook until golden brown, 1 to 2 minutes per side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve warm and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,985 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 164 Calories 8g Fat 17g Carbs 6g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 164 % Daily Value * Total Fat 8g 10% Saturated Fat 3g 17% Cholesterol 111mg 37% Sodium 235mg 10% Total Carbohydrate 17g 6% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 5g Protein 6g 13% Vitamin C 0mg 0% Calcium 66mg 5% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 115mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Dessert Crepes 01 of 277 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 277 Photo by  CopperBrew6628 09/10/2024 OK with tweaks Great recipe. 03 of 277 Photo by  AndreaFeuerstake 03/04/2024 A keeper! Easy to follow Family favorite quick, tasty and makes a nice thin crepe. 04 of 277 Photo by  MBK4LIFE 02/11/2024 I've always been afraid to make crepes but this recipe was easy to follow. Crepes turned out perfectly and we're delicious!My family thinks I'm a chef now! 05 of 277 Photo by  Mary 02/03/2024 Absolutely Perfect! 06 of 277 Photo by  charlesnandi29 01/14/2024 I add lemon Zest and some vanilla extract. 07 of 277 Photo by  Joan Altman 12/07/2023 A keeper! I make these all the time. IMHO it’s the best recipe out there for dessert crepes. The recipe is amazing. 08 of 277 Photo by  WobblyStir1289 10/30/2022 Bon appétit! 09 of 277 Photo by  FrothyChip5947 10/09/2022 I had to reduce the number of eggs to 2 eggs per cup of all purpose flour. I prepared it once with 4 eggs and it give the crepes a distnct omelette taste. I chose to serve it with ice-cream, fruits (berries and bananas) topped with caramel and sea salt. 10 of 277 Photo by  Deborah Smith 06/12/2022 I have several recipes for crepes and this one is best! I use 1 Tb of sugar instead of the two (personal preference). It makes 3 cups of batter and if you use a 1/4 c measure, you get 12 crepes using an omelet pan. Since there is only 2 of us, I save batter after making 6 for the next morning. I stuff with cream cheese fluff or peanut butter and top with pulsed strawberries, perhaps chocolate syrup drizzle, sometimes banana on top of all. Cooking: 1st one takes a tad longer. Heat your pan 1st and use a tad of cooking spray just for the first one. They come out browned one side, flip, do not cook as long, little brown spots is good. There is a video on Allrecipes with this recipe. Thank you! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Regular Crêpes 113 Ratings Chocolate Crepes 30 Ratings Chocolate Banana Crepes 21 Ratings Crêpes 1,209 Ratings Breakfast Crepes 201 Ratings Egg-White Crepes 102 Ratings Love Letter - Crepes 3 Ratings Vanilla Crepes 907 Ratings Strawberry Crepes 75 Ratings Grandma Irena's Palacsinta (Hungarian Crepes) 23 Ratings Eggless Crêpes 58 Ratings Banana Crepes 334 Ratings Crêpes Suzette 2 Ratings Real French Crêpes 138 Ratings Fluffy Swedish Pancakes 117 Ratings Orange-Anise Crepes 7 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
